Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
|--------------|
| Conjugated polymers |
| Thiophene units |

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| band gaps of conjugated polymers |
| more thiophene units |
| between the donor and the acceptor segments |
| more extended π-electron system |
| delocalized π-electron system |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| band gaps of conjugated polymers |
| more extended π-electron system |
| delocalized π-electron system |

Note: "owing to" was not considered as it does not refer to a material property. The other entities in the paragraph, "most reported cases", "incorporating more thiophene units", "between the donor and the acceptor segments" do not clearly refer to material properties as they describe the context or conditions under which the material property (band gaps) is observed or changed.
